SENTENCE.STRING: , officially the Republic of Uzbekistan (Uzbek: O‘zbekiston Respublikasi or O‘zbekiston Jumhuriyati), is a doubly landlocked country in Central Asia.
shares borders with Kazakhstan to the west and to the north, Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan to the east, and Afghanistan and Turkmenistan to the south.
a rather unusual status shared only with Europe's Liechtenstein in that their nation is surrounded entirely by other landlocked states.

The language, Uzbek, is a Turkic language mutually understandable with Turkish and other Turkic languages, however some sources put the ethnic tajiks, an ethnic group closely related to Persians at approximately 42%.
The name Uzbekistan is derived from Persian, meaning "land of the Uzbeks".
The word "Ozbek" means, Real/original/true (Oz) Leaders, Nobles (bek).
